question: I am 37 weeks pregnant, and have been placed on bed rest for pregnancy induce hypertension (NOT preeclampsia, or at least not yet anyway).  My BP is fine as long as I am resting in bed, but if I get up and move around at all, even to fix a meal for my 7 year old, it skyrockets and I become dizzy and nauseated.  My husband is a departmental manager with a pretty demanding work load, so he can't be here to help much, and we can't afford to hire a helper.  I feel completely worthless as a wife and mom when I can't cook our meals, clean our home, do laundry, or anything really.  I feel lost and helpless, and I don't know what to do.  Would my doctor be willing to induce labor a little earlier than what they consider "term" if it is due to the emotional damage this is causing me?  I really don't know how much more I can take...This discussion is related to/posts/show/648879.
title: On bedrest and feeling helpless and worthless
